This study determine whether directly give participant HIV self-test give coupon collect test drug store clinic improves outcomes compare standard care .
DOC.detailed_description: Although Zambia generalize HIV epidemic , approximately 13.3 % adult age 15 49 living HIV , epidemic remains even highly concentrated key population , include female sex worker ( FSW ) . A particular concern FSW access healthcare service , include HIV testing service . FSW face significant barrier access healthcare . In setting , evidence suggest stigma significant barrier FSW seek HIV test . It likely similar mechanism exist Zambia . Evidence Zambia indicate complex multilevel factor , stigmatization harassment , contribute vulnerability among FSW . User-controlled HIV prevention intervention lead empowerment FSW may therefore powerful way address HIV epidemic key population . Oral HIV self-testing consist oral swab kit allow individual test HIV privacy home whenever want . The ease use HIV self-testing , do time , completely private may make attractive alternative currently-available HIV test mechanism FSW Zambia . HIV self-testing generally show acceptable variety population , however evidence related uptake acceptability remain sparse , especially among key population Sub-Saharan Africa . This research provide rigorous evidence uptake efficacy HIV self-testing population . ZEST design determine whether either direct distribution HIV self-test kit via peer educator distribution HIV self-tests via coupon participant use collect kit collection point drug store health post lead good coverage HIV test good awareness HIV status . ZEST cluster-randomized trial peer educator recruit small group FSW participant , peer educator group randomize one three study arm : 1 ) direct distribution test kit , 2 ) fix distribution test kit , 3 ) referral standard care HIV testing . The primary outcome HIV test past month measure one four month first peer educator visit ( test kit coupon distribute intervention arm ) .
DOC.criteria: 18 year age old Female sex Reports exchange sex ( include vaginal , anal , and/or oral ) money good least past month Selfreported HIV negative last HIV test least 3 month OR HIV status unknown Permanent residence study town enrollment ( Kapiri , Livingstone , Chirundu ) Willing visit meet assigned peer educator monthly basis 4month study period Less 18 year age enrollment date Has exchange form sex past one month Selfreported live HIV Selfreported HIV negative status test within past 3 month Living PopART catchment area ( Livingstone ) Concurrently participate another HIV prevention study Meets criterion wish participate Other
